marketNews.title: RI Stops Rice Imports, Highest Stock in 57 Years
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said on Thursday (8/5) that the government will no longer import rice in 2025, following a significant surge in domestic production and stock. Indonesia itself produced 8.61 million tons of rice in 1Q25 (+53% YoY). Meanwhile, Perum Bulog recorded that the government's rice reserve stock at the Bulog Warehouse as of early May 2025 reached 3.6 million tons, marking the highest level in the last 57 years. Besides BPS, the US Department of Agriculture in its report in April 2025 estimated that Indonesian rice production in the 2024/2025 planting season will increase +4.8% YoY to 34.6 million tons, marking the highest production volume projection in the Southeast Asian region. For context, the government targeted national rice production at 32.8 million tons for 2025. The increase in national rice production reflects the recovery post-El Nino during 2023, which impacted early 2024 when domestic rice prices surged around +20% YoY in March 2024. The abundance of national rice supply is also reflected in the decline of rice prices around 1-2% YoY in April 2025, continuing the decline of around 4-9% YoY in March 2025. Key Takeaway: The increase in domestic rice production and stocks has the potential to limit the possibility of rice price spikes like those that occurred in early 2024. Rice prices have tended to be stable since 2H24. If rice management can be done well - so that production increases can continue, but with stable prices (not significantly decreasing) - this has the potential to positively impact community purchasing power and also farmer income. Furthermore, the non-necessity of rice imports can reduce Indonesia's import value. During 10M24, BPS recorded that Indonesia imported 3.48 million tons of rice valued at US$2.2 billion or ~IDR 34.2 trillion.

tickerNews.title: $BUMI: Quasi Reorganization Impact to be Seen in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources said in a clarification to the BEI that the impact of the planned execution of a quasi reorganization will be reflected in the 2Q25 financial statements, if the plan is approved in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on June 2, 2025. BUMI stated that the quasi reorganization allows the company to distribute dividends. BUMI also provided context that the quasi reorganization plan was postponed in 2024 due to a difference in understanding between the company and the OJK regarding the definition of current year profit. At that time, the company used the current year profit attributable to the parent entity as the basis for calculating the fulfillment of quasi reorganization requirements, whereas the OJK required calculation based on total current year profit.

tickerNews.title: $RALS: Ramayana Lestari Sentosa Shareholders Approved 2024 Dividend of IDR 355 Billion
tickerNews.content: Ramayana Lestari Sentosa shareholders approved the distribution of the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to 356 billion rupiah or 60 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 113.3% dividend payout ratio and indicating a 13.1% dividend yield as of Friday (9/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is May 21, 2025, while payment is on June 13, 2025.

tickerNews.title: $PTBA: Minister of ESDM Bahlil Threatens to Revoke Mining Zone Permits If DME Project Is Not Executed
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, affirmed that he will revoke part of the mining business licenses belonging to Bukit Asam if the company does not execute the coal gasification project into dimethyl ether (DME). Previously, PTBA President Director, Arsal Ismail, stated in April 2025 that the company would support the government's directives regarding coal downstreaming projects, including the coal gasification project into DME and substitute natural gas (SNG). However, Arsal mentioned that PTBA will conduct a careful study regarding the DME project, considering that the company's previous partner, Air Products & Chemicals Inc., withdrew from the project in 2023.

tickerNews.title: $PNLF: Panin Financial Unit Plans Sharia Unit Separation to Establish Sharia Insurance Company
tickerNews.content: Panin Financial announced that its business entity, PT Panin Dai-ichi Life, plans to carry out a sharia unit separation by establishing a sharia insurance company named PT Panin Dai-ichi Life Sharia.

tickerNews.title: $PANR to Distribute 2024 Dividend of ~IDR 83.3 Billion and Increases Stake in $PDES
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata will distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend amounting to ~83.3 billion rupiah or 60 rupiah per share, indicating a 7.1% dividend yield as of Friday (9/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is May 9, 2025, while payment is on June 4, 2025. In a separate transaction, PANR increased its ownership in Destinasi Tirta Nusantara ($PDES) by 1.5 million shares at a price of 330 rupiah per share on May 6, 2025. This transaction caused PANR's ownership in PDES to rise from 63.8% to 64.01%.

tickerNews.title: $SMAR Plans to Expand Business Activities to Biogas Procurement, Discussed in June 2025 GMS
tickerNews.content: Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology plans to add business activities for biogas procurement. The construction of this biogas plant aims to capture methane gas generated from palm oil mill effluent (POME) and convert it into compressed biogas (Bio-CNG). This plan will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (AGMS) on June 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: $FAPA: Controlling Shareholder Prinsep Management Limited Sold ~14.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of FAP Agri, Prinsep Management Limited, sold ~14.2 million FAPA shares at a price of 5,300 rupiah per share on April 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached 75.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of Prinsep Management Limited in FAPA decreased from 76.14% to 75.74%.

tickerNews.title: $SMSM: Two Directors Bought SMSM Shares in Early May 2025
tickerNews.content: Two directors of Selamat Sempurna, Sumarni and Roni Kunto, each bought 750,000 and 167,800 SMSM shares, respectively, at an average price of 1,610 rupiah per share on May 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.21 billion rupiah and 271 million rupiah, respectively. After these transactions, Sumarni's ownership in SMSM increased from 0.05% to 0.06%, while Roni Kunto's ownership increased from 0.011% to 0.014%.

tickerNews.title: $BTEK: Shareholder PT Asabri Increased Ownership in BTEK
tickerNews.content: One of the shareholders of Bumi Teknokultura Unggul, PT Asabri, purchased 743 million BTEK shares with an undisclosed transaction value. After this transaction, PT Asabri's ownership in BTEK increased from 8.11% to 9.71%.

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer Agreed on Trade Framework
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, and UK Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, agreed on a trade framework agreement between the two countries on Thursday (8/5). This marks the first trade agreement signed by the US with a trading partner since Trump announced reciprocal tariffs in April 2025. Trump praised the agreement as a 'breakthrough', which is expected to open up other deals to expand market access for American goods. Under the agreement, Trump said that the UK will accelerate customs clearance procedures for US goods and reduce barriers to agricultural, chemical, energy, and industrial exports. Meanwhile, the UK government said that the US will reduce automotive import tariffs to 10% and metal import tariffs to zero. The final details of this framework agreement will still be negotiated over the next few weeks.

tickerNews.title: OPEC Oil Output in April 2025 Fell to 26.6 Million BPD
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that OPEC oil production in April 2025 fell to 26.6 million barrels per day, 30,000 barrels per day lower than March 2025. This decline occurred despite OPEC+ - consisting of OPEC and its allies - planning to increase production in April 2025. The decline in OPEC production in April 2025 was mainly pressured by a drop from Venezuela, where exports contracted due to the cancellation of cargoes to Chevron (NYSE: CVX) amidst US government efforts to disrupt Venezuelan oil exports.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Motorcycle Sales in April 2025 Decreased 3% YoY to 406,691 Units
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in April 2025 dropped to 406,691 units (-3% YoY, -25% MoM). This result brought domestic motorcycle sales during 4M25 to ~2.1 million units (-3% YoY), equivalent to 31-33% of the 2025 target set by AISI in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index Increased to 121.7 in April 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the Indonesian consumer confidence index increased to 121.7 in April 2025 (vs. Mar 2025: 121.1), marking the first increase in the last 4 months. This result was supported by a rise in the current economic conditions index which increased by +3.1 points, while the consumer expectations index fell by -1.9 points due to a decline in the sub-index of employment availability expectations (-2.4 points) and business activity expectations (-3.7 points).

tickerNews.title: Hippindo Sees Potential for Job Reductions in Retail Sector Due to Store Rationalization
tickerNews.content: The General Chairman of the Indonesian Retail and Shopping Center Tenants Association (Hippindo), Budihardjo Iduansjah, said that his party sees the potential for job reductions in the retail sector due to store rationalization. Although there is no official data from members yet, Hippindo assesses that the trend of retail store closures needs to be watched out for. Budihardjo explained that the retail industry generally experienced a performance decline, marked by weak sales during the 2025 Eid al-Fitr period which was not as massive as in previous years.

tickerNews.title: Philippine Nickel Ore Export Ban Could Threaten Indonesian Smelter Supply
tickerNews.content: The Advisor to the Mining Council of the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association, Djoko Widajatno, said that the Philippine government's plan to ban nickel ore exports starting June 2025 could significantly impact nickel smelters in Indonesia. During 2024, Indonesia imported approximately 10 million tons of nickel ore from the Philippines, most of which was used by smelters in the Morowali and Weda Bay regions. Djoko mentioned that the export ban from the Philippines could tighten the supply of nickel ore in the global market and drive up prices. This situation could benefit Indonesian nickel producers in the short term but risks increasing operational costs for smelters.

tickerNews.title: Ministry of ESDM Plans to Stop Fuel Oil Imports from Singapore in the Next 6 Months
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Thursday (8/5) that the government will stop oil imports from Singapore within the next 6 months. Instead, Bahlil mentioned that the government will import oil from Middle Eastern countries and the US. This step is based on considerations of price parity in the Middle East and geopolitical reasons. Kontan reported that about 54-59% of Indonesia's current oil imports originate from Singapore.

tickerNews.title: Bitcoin Price Reached $100,000 Again on Thursday (8/5)
tickerNews.content: The price of Bitcoin again broke through the $100,000 level on Thursday (8/5), marking the first time since February 2025, although still lower than the all-time high set in January 2025 around $109,000. This increase occurred along with the achievement of the trade agreement between the US and the UK, which gave hope for the de-escalation of the trade war.

tickerNews.title: $CMRY Launched Three New Product Variants in Q2 2025
tickerNews.content: The General Manager of Marketing for Milk at Cisarua Mountain Dairy ($CMRY), Sheila Aryyani Hanusanti, said that the company has released a new dessert product named 'Cimory Eat Milk', which has been distributed nationally as of May 1, 2025. The product, packaged in a pouch, comes in 3 flavor variants and is intended to answer the consumption trend of Indonesian people who have a habit of consuming sweet foods after heavy meals.

tickerNews.title: Robert Francis Prevost Elected as 267th Pope, Named Leo XIV
tickerNews.content: Robert Francis Prevost was elected as the 267th Pope. Prevost - who was born in the US and holds Peruvian citizenship - is the first Pope born in the US as well as the second Pope from South America. Prevost chose the name Leo XIV for his pontificate.
